docs.summary: Triggered when a new (draft) campaign is created.
Triggered when a campaign is deleted.
Triggered when a campaign is successfully distributed to all recipients
Triggered each time an email campaign has a new recipient activity.
description:
New recipient activity includes when each email in a campaign is `DELIVERED`, `OPENED`,
or `BOUNCED`. Also, when a URL inside the email is `CLICKED`.

The type of activity that triggered the webhook is in `actionEvent.body` and can be one of:
+ `delivery`: Email was delivered to recipient.
+ `click`: Recipient clicked on a URL in an email.
+ `open`: Recipient opened an email.
+ `softBounce`: Email soft bounced when sent to a recipient.
+ `hardBounce`: Email hard bounced when sent to a recipient.

docs.summary: Triggered when a scheduled campaign is paused.
Triggered when a draft campaign is published.
Triggered when a campaign is identified as abusive and rejected without sending emails to recipients.
Campaign scheduled at a specific time in the future.
Triggered when the mailing list is not clean and campaign was terminated (not sent to all recipients).

members.name: activations
members.doc: number of activations allowed in the given time_frame

members.name: timeFrame
members.doc: set a time frame in minutes for the once_per_user attribute, use 0 for infinite

members.name: campaignId
members.doc: ID of the campaign to archive.

members.name: additionalTranslations
members.doc:
key -> english value, we will include those keys in the translator json and send them for translations.
in the "search rules" api they will be resolved with their translation

members.name: correlationId
members.doc: Automation template correlation id - TODO: rename

members.name: groupIds
members.doc: used to determine which users will see the Automation template while in internal state

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc: Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (for example, [GDPR](https://support.wix.com/en/article/gdpr-frequently-asked-questions)). For advanced users.

members.name: editorType
members.doc: Editor type. Either web app, or mobile app.

members.name: firstImageUrl
members.doc: URL of first image after the logo.

members.name: publishingData
members.doc: Publishing data (present only if campaign is published).

members.name: snapshotImageUrl
members.doc: URL of the landing page snapshot.

members.name: title
members.doc:
Marketing campaign title. For sent campaigns this will match the email subject if subject was not explicitly provided on sending.
For published campaigns - the title will be the first line of text.

members.name: campaignId
members.doc: ID of the campaign that was archived.

description: Sent when status of the campaign is changed from "Active" to "Archived"

members.name: campaignId
members.doc: ID of the campaign that was distributed.

members.name: campaignId
members.doc: ID of the campaign that was paused.

members.name: campaignId
members.doc: ID of the campaign that was published.

members.name: lastActivityDate
members.doc: Date and time of the last activity.

members.name: campaignId
members.doc: ID of the campaign that was rejected.

members.name: campaignId
members.doc: ID of the campaign that was scheduled.

members.name: sendAt
members.doc: The timestamp campaign is scheduled for.

members.name: total
members.doc: Combined landing page and email distribution statistics.

members.name: campaignId
members.doc: ID of the campaign that was terminated.

members.name: campaignId
members.doc: ID of the campaign whose status was changed to active.

description: Sent when status of the campaign is changed from "Archived" to "Active"

members.name: userAgent
members.doc: Browser user agent of the recipient.

members.name: composerDataJson
members.doc: internal data structure for editor/viewer to render the campaign

members.name: campaignEditorType
members.doc: Campaign editor type. Either web app or mobile app.

members.name: templateId
members.doc: ID of the template to fork.

members.name: variables
members.doc: Values to replace template placeholders with (unique for each template).

members.name: templateId
members.doc: ID of the template to fork.

members.name: variables
members.doc: Values to replace template placeholders with (unique for each template).

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: timeZone
members.doc: optional time zone is the full name. example: "Asia/Jerusalem"

members.name: clicked
members.doc:
Number of recipients who clicked a link in the email.

If a single recipient clicks a link in an email twice, it is counted as one unique click.
If a single recipient clicks different links in an email, it is counted as one unique click.

members.name: complained
members.doc: Number of recipients who reported email as spam.

members.name: notSent
members.doc: Number of emails not sent because the campaign was terminated.

members.name: opened
members.doc:
Number of recipients who opened an email.

If a single recipient opens an email twice, it is counted as one unique open.

members.name: hardBounce
members.doc:
Email hard bounced when sent to a recipient.

Indicates a permanent error sending your email. For example, the email address does not exist.

members.name: softBounce
members.doc:
Email soft bounced when sent to a recipient.

Indicates a temporary issue sending your email. For example, the email server receiving the email is under a heavy load.
For soft bounces, you should wait and try again at a later time.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Date and time of the event.

members.name: hardBounce
members.doc:
Email hard bounced when sent to a recipient.

Indicates a permanent error sending your email. For example, the email address does not exist.

members.name: softBounce
members.doc:
Email soft bounced when sent to a recipient.

Indicates a temporary issue sending your email. For example, the email server receiving the email is under a heavy load.
For soft bounces, you should wait and try again at a later time.

members.name: contactIds
members.doc: Contact IDs to send campaign to.

members.name: emailSubject
members.doc: Subject of an email sent to recipient.

members.name: filterIds
members.doc: Filter ids to send campaign to.

members.name: labelIds
members.doc: Label IDs to send campaign to.

members.name: sendAt
members.doc: For scheduling (at least one hour in the future, for premium users only).

members.name: templateId
members.doc: template ID configured for the automation

members.name: optionIncludeStatistics
members.doc: If true, campaign should contain statistics (default is 'false').

members.name: templateId
members.doc: template ID configured for the ping automation.

members.name: clicked
members.doc: Number of times a link was clicked in landing page.

members.name: opened
members.doc: Number of times landing page was loaded or viewed.

members.name: campaignType
members.doc: Filter by the following campaign types.

members.name: optionIncludeStatistics
members.doc: Whether a campaign should contain statistics (default is 'false').

members.name: statuses
members.doc: Include campaigns with the following statuses (no filtering by default).

members.name: visibilityStatuses
members.doc: Include campaigns with the following visibility statuses (no filtering by default).

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Details on the paged set of returned results.

members.name: campaignIds
members.doc:
IDs of the campaigns to retrieve.

Max: 100 campaigns

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency code. Must be valid ISO 4217 currency code (e.g., USD).

members.name: formattedValue
members.doc: Monetary amount. Decimal string in local format (e.g., 1 000,30). Optionally, a single (-), to indicate that the amount is negative.

members.name: value
members.doc: Monetary amount. Decimal string with a period as a decimal separator (e.g., 3.99). Optionally, a single (-), to indicate that the amount is negative.

description:
Money.
Default format to use. Sufficiently compliant with majority of standards: w3c, ISO 4217, ISO 20022, ISO 8583:2003.

members.name: userAgent
members.doc: Browser user agent of the recipient.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: campaignId
members.doc: ID of the campaign to preview.

members.name: placeholders
members.doc: Values to replace campaign placeholders with (unique for each campaign).

members.name: variables
members.doc: Values to replace campaign placeholders with (unique for each campaign).

members.name: emailDistributionOptions
members.doc: Email distribution options - provided only if marketing campaign is intended to be distributed via email.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was applied to the request

members.name: campaignId
members.doc: ID of the campaign to resend.

members.name: campaignId
members.doc: ID of the newly created and resent campaign

members.name: campaignId
members.doc: ID of the message to be duplicated.

members.name: canBeSuspended
members.doc: default value is 'true', when this is set to 'false' user wont be able to toggle off the rule

members.name: notes
members.doc: additional notes to describe the rule

members.name: versionType
members.doc: will be used to indicate to user how urgent is this change during "version" changes

members.name: emailSubject
members.doc: Subject of an email sent to recipient.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: clicked
members.doc: Number of landing page link clicks + email link clicks.

members.name: opened
members.doc: Number of landing page views + emails opened.

members.name: reengagementDelaySec
members.doc: Trigger Reengagement delay internal in sec
